caption.title:
Sensitivity of variance in population (ln N
t ) to variability of the mortality rate μ 0 for the youngest sub-adult class.
caption.p:
We used simulations of Model 2 with noise (uncorrelated). (a) Total variance as a function of the value of mortality rate μ 0 in the earliest stage. The distribution of strategy-types shows that Type III organisms have greater μ 0 and this leads to a greater proportion of the overall variance in populations being dependent on the variability of this parameter. The distribution of the major strategy types shows that Type III organisms have greater μ 0 and this leads to a greater overall variance in population growth rate. The curve corresponds to a best fit, after Eq ( 4), of the equation
V = a + b
μ 0 2
based on Eq ( 4). (b) Proportion of variability explained by variations in pre-reproductive survival for different organisms (see Fig 1) as a function of μ 0.
